text: You know what? I actually wouldn't mind another Paper Mario game in this game's style. As long as the story is good, the humor is fresh, it gives a decent challenge, and it expands upon SPM's core gameplay.

author: Doughboy123x

text: Welcome back to Castle Bleck, Lord Commander (OK, that was too easy). Color Splash looks quite intriguing, though you have to be cautiously excited after Sticker Star's disappointment. I'm still not sure I understand why they decided to move away from many of the series' RPG elements after TTYD, starting with this game. I do have to say that I absolutely loved Super Paper Mario, so it's not necessarily a negative.
author: SupraDarky

text:
I mean Super Paper Mario was great all it tried  to do was put the MARIO in Paper MARIO, and imo it succeeded in blending the two... then sticker star and now colour splash have taken up the route of trail and error bosses where you use an item to instantly win and I dunno why at all other than to make it unnecessarily gimmicky.

That being said this is some Awesome music!
author: Bainbridge

text: It started when Miyamoto told them (when they started making Super PM) that he wanted them to try new stuff and innovate instead of just keeping the TTYD gameplay.  Recently when asked about the removal of rpg stuff, the director said that Nintendo already has the Mario & Luigi series for the traditional RPG elements (though it's not a good reason in my opinion, but it's what she said).
author: Phenom Uprising

text: @Nuahsy It's not worth my £8/$11
author: Bainbridge

text:
When Sticker Star was made, Shigeru Miyamoto said that they should focus on gameplay and not story fr handheld games. Imo there are  two big things with saying this: the gameplay in Sticker Star is the least good in the series (still enjoyable, but not as enjoyable), and turn based games need to be interesting to keep the player interested. When they removed the story and all of the characters, and replaced everything with generic toads, Sticker Star kinda lost this.

That being said, Sticker Star is good, but the least good in the series.
author: Eirian Odalis
